items: Find a sturdy pull-up bar that can support your weight.
Stand facing the bar and grip it with one hand, using an underhand grip (palm facing towards you).
Hang from the bar with your arm fully extended and your shoulder engaged.
Slowly pull yourself up towards the bar, keeping your elbow close to your body.
Continue pulling until your chin is above the bar.
Lower yourself back down to the starting position with control.
Repeat for desired number of reps, then switch arms and repeat on the other side.

content.title: One Arm Chin Up Form & Visual

items: Increases upper body strength, particularly in the back, biceps, and forearms
Improves grip strength and overall grip endurance
Challenges and improves core stability and control
Helps to correct muscle imbalances between the left and right sides of the body
Can be a great way to progress towards more advanced bodyweight exercises, such as the muscle up
